(2) frontend appears to connect to database directly — need to audit and determine if API-mediated access is needed. Requires collaborative discussion and proposal.

title: Verify: Rebuild federation locally and confirm no global CSS injection
description: After patching build-federation.js, rebuild the federation bundle and verify: (1) remoteEntry.js calls dynamicLoadingCss with true, (2) no <link> tag for style-*.css appears in document <head>, (3) CSS is only inside shadow roots, (4) Angular layout remains unaffected.
close_reason: Verified: served remoteEntry.js has 0 false flags, 5 true flags. CSS file still served for Shadow DOM. No global <link> injection possible.

title: Investigate: React CSS style leakage into Angular dashboard in dev
description: Dolly observed React styles affecting the original Angular dashboard in dev, likely due to style leakage in module federation. Shadow DOM isolation may not be working correctly in the deployed environment. Screenshots attached in Slack thread (dev-squad, 2026-02-19 06:55 EST).
close_reason: Verified on dev: 0 federation CSS <link> tags in document.head. Angular layout renders correctly. React components render correctly. Fix: patched build-federation.js Phase 3.

title: Fix: 'Loading...' persists at bottom of AgentOverview component
description: On the Overview tab (AgentOverview federation component), a 'Loading...' indicator persists at the bottom of the page below the Knowledge Bases section. Visible both locally and in dev. This is the same issue Dolly and Dhruv reported. Need to identify which data fetch is hanging or which loading state never resolves. Likely in the AgentOverview or AgentDetailV1 React component.
close_reason: Root cause: Jarvis chat wrapper isLoading=true but loadComponent() gated behind visible=true. Fix: gate template on visible. PR #958 on copilot-dashboard.

title: Test CSS style isolation locally — verify Shadow DOM fix before investigating dev
description: Before investigating gn2 (CSS leakage in dev), reproduce and verify locally. Steps: (1) Start platform group via local-dev.sh, (2) Build federation bundle, (3) Load Angular dashboard with federated React components, (4) Verify no style leakage from React/Tailwind into Angular/PrimeFlex. This confirms whether the fix works locally and the issue is deployment-specific.

title: Fix: Jarvis headless baseline duplicates rubric/test set creation after subagents complete
description: During 'Generate Baseline' headless flow, Jarvis spawns two subagents (test_set_creator + rubric_creator) in parallel via the Task tool. After subagents successfully create the rubric and test set, Jarvis doesn't recognize they already exist and attempts to create them again itself, which fails. Likely a prompt or context issue — the subagent results may not be surfaced back to Jarvis properly, or the evaluation Jarvis prompt doesn't instruct it to check for existing artifacts before creating new ones. Relevant code: scripts/seed_jarvis_templates.py (~line 401 EVALUATION_JARVIS_PROMPT). Observed on devcopilot.indemn.ai 2026-02-19 with Test Agent (Jupiter).

title: Fix: Patch remoteEntry.js to set dontAppendStylesToHead=true in build script
description: The federation plugin's dynamicLoadingCss injects CSS into the document <head> globally (dontAppendStylesToHead=false), causing Tailwind/React styles to leak into Angular. CSS is already delivered to Shadow DOM via createShadowMount + styles.ts. Fix: add a post-processing step in scripts/build-federation.js after the second build pass to flip false→true in dynamicLoadingCss calls in remoteEntry.js.
close_reason: Patched build-federation.js Phase 3: replaces dynamicLoadingCss false→true in remoteEntry.js. Build verified, all 5 exposed components patched.

title: Backend/Frontend Separation — percy-service
description: Separate Python FastAPI backend from React frontend in copilot-dashboard-react into new percy-service repo. Design: artifacts/2026-02-19-backend-separation-design.md

title: Investigate: Evaluations failing at baseline generation — Jarvis not initialized in dev dashboard
description: Dolly reports evaluations fail at the baseline generation step in the dev environment. She also says Jarvis is not initialized in the dashboard. Need to investigate: (1) Is Jarvis seeded on dev? (2) Is the jarvis-default agent present in the indemn_platform DB on dev? (3) Are the evaluation connectors working? (4) Is bot-service /llm-evaluate/invoke reachable from evaluations service? (5) What does the failure look like — error response or silent hang? Screenshots in Slack dev-squad thread 2026-02-19 06:55 EST.
notes: Root cause: EVALUATION_SERVICE_URL missing from platform-v2 container .env on dev EC2. Connector defaulted to http://localhost:8002 which fails inside Docker. Fix: added EVALUATION_SERVICE_URL=http://evaluations:8080 to .env, restarted container. Jarvis baseline generation now works end-to-end.

title: Fix: Jarvis avatar icons not loading in dev dashboard
description: In the Jarvis chat modal on devcopilot.indemn.ai, the Jarvis avatar/icon next to messages shows as a broken image placeholder. Visible in both the greeting message and tool call results. Likely a broken asset path — the image URL may reference localhost or a relative path that doesn't resolve correctly in the deployed federation bundle. Check the JarvisChat component and federation image asset handling (VITE_FEDERATION_BASE_URL).
notes: Root cause: VITE_FEDERATION_BASE_URL not set during Docker build. Asset URLs were root-relative resolving against Angular host instead of federation origin. Fix: added ARG/ENV to Dockerfile + build-args in CI/CD workflows. Commit 6cc1893.
